sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Good morning, Europe. It is Thursday, the 8th of September. I'm Helena Humphrey, and here are your top stories.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The chase is finally over. The last suspect charged with Canada's mass stabbing has died after he was captured by police in Saskatchewan.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: You'll freeze. Russian President Vladimir Putin warns the EU not to put a price cap on Russian gas, which is due to be discussed today by the bloc's energy ministers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: And it's getting hot in Buenos Aires.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: As the International Tango Festival and Championship begins, it's expected to draw over 1,500 dancers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The manhunt for a suspect in Canada's mass stabbing has ended with his death after he was captured by police.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Footage from the scene showed a white SUV apparently run off the road and surrounded by officers and their vehicles near Rossthorne Town in Saskatchewan.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Thirty-two-year-old Miles Sanderson is said to have died from self-inflicted wounds.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: His brother's body, Damien, was found on Monday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Shortly after his arrest, he went into medical distress.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Nearby, EMS were called by police to attend the scene and he was transported to a hospital in Saskatoon.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: He was pronounced deceased at the hospital. Sanderson had been facing multiple murder charges for his alleged role in a knife attack that devastated the James Smith Cree nation, an indigenous community and the nearby village of Weldon. Ten people died in the attacks and 18 more were wounded.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The rampage ranks as among the worst acts of mass violence in Canada's modern history.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Energy companies will need to make some contributions to help with the energy crisis and high energy bills for citizens. This is one piece of the emergency measures proposed by the European Commission

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: to deal with astronomical prices for electricity.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Brussels wants fossil fuel companies to reroute part of their unexpected profits to a solidarity contribution to relieve the impact on vulnerable households.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: There's also to be a cap on revenues of companies producing electricity with low production costs like renewables and nuclear.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: So, good afternoon.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: It is now time for the consumers to benefit from the low costs of low carbon sources, like for example the renewables.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: We will propose to re-channel these unexpected profits.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: We channel them to the member states so that the member states can support the vulnerable households and vulnerable companies.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: According to the proposal, a liquidity fund for energy companies should be created to help them face the volatility of the market.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: But moreover, the European Commission wants to cut Russian revenues by putting a price cap on Russian pipeline gas imports we all know that our sanctions are deeply grinding into the Russian economy with a heavy negative impact but Putin is partially buffering through fossil fuel revenues so here the objective is we must cut Russia's revenues, which Putin uses to finance his atrocious war in Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The EU has reduced its gas imports from Russia from 40% before the war to 9% today, but Russia is still getting some revenue.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, Brussels also wants to impose mandatory targets for peak demand hours.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: All the measures will be discussed on Friday by EU energy ministers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Shona Murray, Euronews, Brussels.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: EU member states are mulling over some of the proposals put forward by the European Commission

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: aimed at targeting the ongoing energy crisis.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Some of the proposals include a price cap on Russian gas, something that's not without its risks, although we did hear that the EU has reduced from 40% to 9% its reliance on Russian gas in the last few months.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Another proposal deals with a revenue cap on electricity companies generating electricity from low-cost sources like renewables, like nuclear. And another proposal, the mandatory cut in consumption of energy, which is something that member states would have to work out for themselves.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Now, we'll hear from energy ministers from each member state on Friday where they convene here in Brussels for an emergency meeting.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Shona Murray, Euronews, Brussels.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: News Brussels. As fears heighten that Europe is plunging deeper into an energy crisis, could this be

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: a sign of the future?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Denmark is preparing for a slightly dimmer Christmas this year to counteract soaring costs.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Street lighting will be subdued if not switched off. In some places local authorities are even considering cutting Christmas lights and annual ice skating.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: It's beautiful in the month of December here and it would be a shame if that is where we are going to save. And we have a big Christmas tree on the main square with lights on as well.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Schools and other public buildings are set to have their thermostats turned down.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Even one degree cooler can make a difference to energy bills.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: If you had turned it down to 16 degrees, we would have been sitting in here with hats and gloves on.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: But one degree less, I don't think that makes a big difference.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Lights like these could be switched off between 10pm and 5am if public safety allows for it.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Research shows that cutting street light use by one hour per day could save around 14,000 euros per year in an average town.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Ukrainians in the heavily shelled city of Kramatorsk are getting ready for the freezing temperatures of winter.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The gas was cut off in May in the Donetsk region, which is partly controlled by Russian forces, and in the neighbouring occupied Lugansk region after damage to infrastructure.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Residents have been reduced to scavenging for firewood.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: We are worrying quite a lot because the winter is going to be very hard.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: It will be uncomfortable for us.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Preparations are also underway for underground bunkers where they can huddle together to keep warm. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy had called for mandatory evacuation of civilians from the Donetsk region in July, both to avoid the fighting and ahead of the winter season.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: A stack of wood ovens have been bought by the city, ready to be delivered to residents.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Elsewhere the director of a local hospital fear she won't be able to keep the sick warm as supply shortages bite I am worried a lot because a healthy person can feel comfortable in different conditions but a sick person requires a specific temperature. They need warmth during treatment, operations and check-ups. Despite the hardships, locals say they're standing strong.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: NASA's James Webb Space Telescope has captured thousands of never-before-seen young stars in the Tarantula Nebula stellar nursery. The young stars were previously shrouded from view by cosmic dust. Astronomers are using the telescope to take a closer look at the region and determine the chemical makeup of a prominent older star and its surrounding gas.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: oldest star and its surrounding gas.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Even if just for a day, the world's oldest film festival in Venice took a pause from the showbiz glitz and glamour holding a Ukraine Day.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: It was in support of artists from the war-torn country and to increase the awareness of the plight of the Ukrainian people several actors had already shown their solidarity with Ukraine with Tilda Swinton dying her hair a bright yellow as half of the Ukrainian flag with the film Freedom on Fire Ukraine's fight for freedom being part of a day of events crew members met with photographers to get their views across.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: For critic Deborah Young, the influence of film goes beyond mere entertainment.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: You can go to a film festival, you can see a movie about a country, and it's not the news footage that we're seeing every day on our TVs.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: It's something so personal and so strong and gives you such a different approach and a different idea about what is really happening there.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: And its effect on the heroine or the hero, its effect on the people in the film creates an emotional bond.
